text: Boris Maksimovich Gurevich (; 23 March 1931 – 10 January 1995) was a flyweight Greco-Roman wrestler from the Soviet Union. He won gold medals at the 1952 Olympics, the 1953 world championships, and the 1958 world championships. Gurevich first trained in gymnastics and later took up wrestling in 1948. He won the Soviet wrestling titles in 1950 and 1955, placed second in 1952, 1959, and 1960, and placed third in 1963. After retiring from competitions he coached wrestlers in Moscow, where an annual international wrestling tournament has been held in his honor since 1996. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1931 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Olympic wrestlers of the Soviet Union Category:Wrestlers at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Soviet male sport wrestlers Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Sportspeople from Moscow Category:Olympic medalists in wrestling Category:Soviet Jews Category:Jewish wrestlers Category:Medalists at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:World Wrestling Championships medalists Category:Russian State University of Physical Education, Sport, Youth and Tourism alumni
title: Boris Gurevich (wrestler, born 1931)
